title: For Sale:  GERMAN SIG SAUER SP2022 9mm NIGHT SIGHTS- 3 MAGS-TRIPLE SERIAL#
postcontent:
I have a like new Sig Sauer SP2022 9mm for sale with only 50 rounds through it. This is a SA/DA gun with decocker so its very safe to keep one in the pipe. This is the sought after triple serial number german model, has serial on frame , barrel and slide. It has German Sig sticker on box , is made in Germany and box is marked expo for export. Has the Ilaflon finish (shinier/much more durable, like glock tenifer ) that can only be put on the guns in europe, epa wont allow it to be used here. Gun has night sights that are still very bright just as new. Comes with box, 3 factory sig sauer (15rd)mags, night sights, 2 cleaning (bore) brushes, rod , lubricant and lock,manuals. Great gun for the money and has all the quality of the metal sigs for half the price. $515 firm since this is the german made model . You can get a new one (night sights,usa made) for about $500 online after paying an ffl the $25 transfer fee however they only come with 1 mag(mags are $40ea) and aren't near the quality of the german made models, the craftsmanship is much better. Ive seen them on sale for $450 at gander mtn but it is the usa made model ,1 mag and not night sights. This thing is built like a tank and the rails on this gun are thick and meaty and can be replaced. The rails are also steel like the slide unlike the  metal sigs where the steel slide rides on aluminum and must be heavily greased. This gun as made for the french police and made for thousands and thousands of rounds. I owned an HK p30 once and this gun has quality on par with that, no tooling marks on inside of slide etc.  Bruce Gray of gray guns who specializes in  working on sigs etc can carry any gun he wants and he carries an sp2022,that speaks volumes for this pistol. If you are wondering why I would get rid of such a nice pistol , I really don't want to . My only other 9mm is my small carry 9mm and I carry it so I cant sell it. 

*******NOTE - Please realize I am in the salem/roanoke,va area before replying to ad, I will not drive to sell it *********************


Also no shady characters and I require va id and buyer to sign bill of sale

title: For Sale/Trade:  GSG-AK47 22
postcontent:
Gently Used GSG AK47 (About 200-300 Rounds Shot through it.) Very Clean and well maintained. Fun gun to shoot gives you the look and feel of an AK with the 7.62 however it is much more economical and is chambered in 22 LR.

Below is the details from the website.



http://www.americantactical.us/174/detail.html


The .22lr “Kalashnikov” manufactured by GSG represents much more than a small caliber “knock-off” of a famous rifle. The GSG-AK47 is not only a well-made rifle, common of the German engineering we have come to appreciate, but it actually bears the name “Kalashnikov.” GSG is currently the only company in the entire world licensed by Mr. Kalashnikov to manufacture real, functioning firearms, and they have not taken this opportunity lightly. The low cost of shooting .22lr ammo is attractive, but not really at the expense of an unfamiliar rifle with awkward controls and an uncertain reliability aspect. Fortunately for those who of us who like military rifles, all these issues were not a factor with the GSG-AK47. The look, feel and controls are almost identical to the most heavily proliferated rifle system in the world. From the first time it is handled and shouldered, the heavy wood and comfortable stock length give the shooter the real feel of a familiar rifle. The magazine works and looks great and the accuracy potential was surprisingly well. Whether it is for los-cost training on the real system, a departure from the usual noise to give your neighbors a break, to help a youngster learn to handle this style rifle without the recoil and intimidation of the muzzle blast or just plain for fun, we think the GSG-AK47 will make a nice addition to any military firearms collection. -Jeff zimba, small arms review magazine


Caliber/Gauge: 22LR
Color/Finish: Matte Black
Barrel length: 16.5

title: For Sale/Trade:  1962 Browning Belgium Made A-5 12ga Magnum w/Hand Carved Stock
postcontent:
Up for sale is this very nice 1962 Belgian made Browning Automatic 5 (A-5) Belgium made 3" Magnum with a 31.5" barrel (12 gauge water fowl gun).  Might make a good trap or skeet gun with the long barrel and full choke.  The barrel is in like new condition and the blue on the entire gun at about 90 to 95%.  The barrel has a "*" stamped in the barrel where is it stamped magnum which indicates a full choke.  The serial number on this shotgun is 2v 44XXX.  This serial number confirms the year and that is was originally a 12ga magnum.  It will shoot either 3" magnum loads or 2&3/4" shells.  The recoil system is adjustable between the two loads and is currently set for the 2&3/4 shells.  The shotgun holds 5 in the magazine and one in the pipe.  The 3 round plug is removed but is included.  The brass rings for setting the recoil back to magnum are also included.  The fancy carved butt stock installed on this shotgun is from a 1933 Automatic Five (A-5) (serial number 141641) and is in wonderful condition , especially for it's age (not perfect but very nice).  The original magnum fore-grip is installed on the shotgun now because the magnum has a longer recoil tube that the 1933 Browning shotguns, so the 1933 forgrip could not be installed.  I have the original serial numbered butt stock and it is included as well.  The original wood is in nice very condition but the clear varnish coating has a few chips in it.  The gun also comes with an original Browning soft case.  The shotgun is cleaned, oiled, serviced and ready to shoot.  Please see the pictures for proof marks. 

To sum up what you get for my asking price is:

1962 Browning 2V 44XXX 12ga Magnum A5 Shotgun
Original Browning soft carrying case
Original Stocks serial numbered to the shotgun
1933 Hand carved stocks serial number 141641 for A-5 12ga
Original 3 shell plug for water fowl hunting
Original rings to set recoil back to the magnum level

I am asking $975 for everything listed above but will listen to reasonable cash offers.  Trades considered: Semi-Auto 12ga or 410ga shotguns Single Action Revolvers, Quality 1911's, .223 Riffles and anything interesting.  Lets talk.

Send you contact information through the email and I will get back to you.  Thanks for looking

How much am I asking.....$250,000.00, because I know you’ll want to talk me down on price, so let’s start there. I plan to end up with $14,000.00 in my pocket, or guns.
 If your guns aren't worth $14,000.00, you’ll need to add cash, or maybe even a Harley to make up the difference. 


You will not find a nicer, cleaner low hour boat than this for the year. The boat looks near new, no rips, no tears, 121 hours, 350 magnum, bravo 1 drive, new $400.00 cover,  washed after every use,  no oil leaks, oil and fluids changed.
I am anal with keeping this boat clean and perfect and maintained.

I replace parts because they "might" go bad, not because they are bad.
This boat is in tip top running condition at all times. 

Will also trade for Leer Jet, will need flying lessons.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Remington 7600 .30-06 pump-action rifle fs/ft
postcontent:
I have a Remington 7600 pump-action rifle chambered in .30-06. I bought it a few months back on impulse, and have since decided I don't really need it. 

The rifle shoots well, and includes a 3-9x50 scope, one magazine, and gun sock. Accuracy is on par with the Remington 700 line of bolt-action rifles, but the pump-action allows for quicker follow-up shots. 

Was bought used, but I've only put one box of ammo through it for function testing. Has a couple of scratches, but nothing too bad. Would make an excellent deer gun.

Asking $425 obo, will also consider trades of similar value. 

I am a reasonable guy, so feel free to make an offer outside of the included suggestions. These are simply a list of what I'm looking for. Also, I'd prefer either straight trade or "you add". Trying not to spend any more money on guns this year.

I can include the original 40 silver brass cases that went through for your reloading.  I may be able to get your more through a friend if you're interested.

This setup was made to be a long range nail driver, I shot 200-250 yards at the prone with ALL bullets millimeters from touching, no bs, this setup is VERY accurate, I can prove this statement.   I never had a chance to go shoot any further.

Everything in this setup is in immaculate condition, I pamper my guns and I only buy the highest quality.

You can keep your home made bushmaster, DPMS, Colt, Palmetto PSA, and other cheap home made rifles - Ive got tons of emails offering me these types of rifles + $1000 for this setup, you have no idea what you're doing, im not giving you double your trade value.

postcontent:
Here I have a recent build that I need to sell to help pay for a new safe.  Its an original 1986 Russian Tula Krinkov AKS74U rifle chambered in 5.45x39.  It is a numbers matching kit that is built on an armory USA receiver.  It has a side optics rail (which is pretty uncommon on krink builds), as well as the proper pistol grip reinforcement plate.  It has been painted with allumahyde II and a dark satin black. 

It has all of the necessary US 922r compliance parts, which are the receiver, ergo hogue pistol grip, g2 trigger group, and Kvar black hand guards.  It also has a trigger group plate, although it doesn't count as 922r, its a nice addition that makes cleaning and disassembly a breeze. 

The barrel is an original east german chrome lined ak74 barrel that has been turned to a krink profile, and kept at 16" to meet the minimum 16" length.  These are one of the few barrels that don't keyhole once they are cut to 8 1/2"  So all you need is to complete your tax stamp for an sbr, and your good to go.  Just chop and recrown your barrel. 

These kits run $800, barrel another $400(if you can find one), machine work to the barrel another $150, compliance parts, receiver etc you can see there is a lot of money wrapped up here not including the build.  I have an original unsanitized Russian Molot RPK74 mag that I will let go with the gun at my price(worth ~$150).  I want to sell for what I have in parts(not including the build) in order to upgrade to a bigger gun safe.  I also have a little russian ball ammo I might include with the rifle as well.



These rifles are all over gun broker for $1800-$3300.  I am selling for $1400 OBO. 

I would also be willing to trade for a new Liberty Colonial 50 in new shape, with possibly a little cash on my end depending on accessories.

title: For Sale:  AK Gas Tube Ratchet Charging System
postcontent:
This is a Dublin AK ratchet system that turns your piston tube into a left-sided charging handle.  It allows the piston to move without moving the handle, while also allowing you to chamber another round all while only using your left hand!

This system works for the following gun gmodels:
Bulgarian AK-74
Saiga .223/5.56
Saiga 7.62x39
Polish Tantal 5.45

Here is the description from the website:

THE NEW 2nd GENERATION!

The Kalashnikov does not get simpler than this! We guarantee you will notice a decreased reloading time due to a more natural manual of arms.

RCS 2nd GENERATION Upper Charging system for Kalashnikov Rifles
Machined on the best CNC machines, this package contains everything necessary to convert a standard Kalashnikov variant rifle into one with a non- reciprocating forward charging system. This item replaces the original gas tube with a new one that contains a new charging handle and slide. The new charging handle protrudes from the left side directly over the forearm of the rifle for easier and less troublesome charging. The pre-existing charging handle on the right side is now unnecessary and can be discarded to eliminate all exterior moving parts. All hardware is included. No gunsmithing required. MADE IN THE USA.

Guaranteed quality, all of our parts pass a fit and function test before they are made available for purchase.  

Advantages when compared to original charging system:
Non-reciprocating handle
Allows for faster reloading due to less hand manipulation
Easier function for a right handed operator
Quicker cooling
Unproblematic reloading when firing from the prone position and or around barriers
Unlike other left sided charging systems, with the Ratchet Charging system you can use your left side optics rail and it does not open up your critical trigger components.
The operator no longer loses sight picture or situational awareness while loading
Easier to clear miss feed or jam
Built to outlast the life of the firearm
Built from the finest metals and long lasting black matte finish
Self cleaning design allows dirt and debris to easily exit the gas tube.
If original charging handle is removed:
Safety can be engaged when chambering a round
Eliminates all exterior moving parts
We make it easy for the operator; installation takes minutes and does not require a gun smith. This part was made to outlast the firearm. We guarantee you will decrease your loading time. The key is giving the operator a charging handle in a natural location (on the forearm) decreasing the amount of hand manipulation.

Call or text 9two8-sixhundred-80six2

Email is ok as well, just put "trust but verify!" in the subject line or you will not be responded to!
